result.execSummary:
The defendant William M. Eck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William M. Eck in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Poquette makes statement regarding restitution.  The state notified the victim of this hearing and notified him he needed to be present at the hearing if he wished to request restitution.  Victim impact statement was sent, but the amounts of restitution requested by the victim were not supported by any documentation or detailed explanation.  
The state is unable to request restitution based on the vague Victim Impact Statement and the failure of the victim to appear in court for hearing.
State notes that the Victim could still seek compensation in civil court.

Defendant William M. Eck in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentence imposed and stayed:  90 days county jail.  DEF is placed on one year of probation.    AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  $589 fine/costs including $200 DNA surcharge.  
Court orders no restitution.  State notified victim of this hearing, Victim was told he needed to be present to request restitution.  Paperwork submitted by victim requesting restitution is too vague and no supporting backup was submitted.

Defendant William M. Eck in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant entered plea of nc.  Court finds defendant guilty count 1 and counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read-in.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.  Restitution Hearing Status Conference scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant William M. Eck in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have not reached agreement.  Set for trial.  
  Jury trial scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant William M. Eck in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  10:44 AM  Court calls case recites appearances.  Atty requests a continues status date.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
